title: How to Prepare Vegetables for Skewers

steps.headline: Wash 6 red potatoes, medium zucchini, medium yellow squash, pepper, 15 mushrooms and 15 cherry tomatoes.
Quarter 6 small red potatoes.
steps.description: Boil them in a large pot of salted boiling water for 3 minutes. Rinse in cold water and drain the potatoes. Set aside to dry after they are rinsed or pat dry.

steps.headline: Prepare your marinade while you are waiting for your potatoes.
steps.description: Pour 4 tbsp. (59 ml) vinegar into a bowl. Apple cider, white wine, red wine or sherry vinegar are good choices. Add 4 tbsp. (63 g) Dijon mustard. Mince and add 2 small shallots or 1 small onion. Add 2 tbsp. (30 ml) lemon juice. Add 2/3 cup (158 ml) olive oil. Whisk to combine. It should take a few minutes for the olive oil to combine with the other ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste. For a bolder flavor, add 2 tbsp. (30 g) fresh chopped rosemary. Set the mixture aside.

steps.headline: Cut a medium zucchini and a medium yellow squash into approximately 12 rounds each.
Cut a medium red onion and a medium red or green pepper into 1-inch (2.54 cm) pieces.
Remove stems from 15 to 20 cremini or button mushrooms.
Toss the cut vegetables and the tomatoes with the marinade in a large bowl, making sure they are well-covered.
Marinate the vegetables for 2 to 24 hours before grilling.
Soak about 12 wooden skewers in warm water 30 minutes before you intend to grill.
steps.description: You do this so that they don't break or burn when they are on the grill. If you are using metal skewers, you can skip this step.

steps.headline: Preheat the barbecue or grill to medium-high heat.
Thread your vegetables on your soaked skewers after they have soaked for 30 minutes.
steps.description: If you are intending to serve them on the skewers, alternate the vegetables. Leave about 1/4 inch (2/3 cm) room between each vegetable. For the most even grilling, thread the same vegetable on each skewer. Cooking times between vegetables will vary between 3 and 10 minutes. You can remove the quicker cooking vegetables and leave others on the grill.

steps.headline: Brush the grill with vegetable oil right before grilling.
Place the skewers on the grill and cook them for about 5 minutes on each side.
steps.description: They should be soft but darkened on the outside.

steps.headline: Remove the skewers and serve the grilled vegetables immediately.
